questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.

questions.uddipok:
William Wordsworth was one of the most influential Romantic poets. He was born on April 7, 1770 at Cockermouth, Lake District of England. When he was eight years old, his mother died and in the same year he was sent to Grammar School of Hawkshaw. Wordsworth's father died five years after his mother's death. His father was a lawyer. As a young man, Wordsworth developed a love of nature, a theme reflected in many of his poems. In 1787, he entered into St. John's College at the University of Cambridge where he studied for four years until he took his B.A Degree. In 1786, two sets of his verses were published and in 1789 he finished writing the 'Evening Walk'. While studying at Cambridge University, he undertook the walking tour in France and Switzerland in 1790 with his friend Robert Jones. In 1795, Wordsworth received a legacy from a close relative and he and his sister Dorothy went to live in Dorset. Two years later, they moved to Somerset, to live near the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, who was an admirer of Wordsworth's work. They collaborated on 'Lyrical Ballads', published in 1798. In 1799, after a visit to Germany with Coleridge. Wordsworth's most famous poem, 'I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud' was written at Dove Cottage in 1804. In 1842, he was given a government pension and the following year became a poet laureate. Wordsworth died on 23 April 1850 and was buried in Grasmere Churchyard.

Write a summary of the above passage in your own words. :

sub_questions.explanation: William Wordsworth, born in 1770 in the Lake District of England, was a renowned Romantic poet known for his deep love of nature. After losing both parents at a young age, he attended grammar school in Hawkshead and later studied at St. John's College, Cambridge. During his student years, he traveled to France and Switzerland. Wordsworth’s literary journey included writing notable poems such as The Evening Walk and I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud. He collaborated with Samuel Taylor Coleridge on Lyrical Ballads, a significant work in English literature. In 1843, he was appointed poet laureate and passed away in 1850.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "The Importance of Learning Computer".
a) Why is computer so important? b) Where do we use computer? c) What things can a computer do? d) Which jobs need the knowledge of computer? e) Why does a student need to learn computer?

sub_questions.explanation:
The Importance of Learning Computer
Computers have become an essential part of our daily lives, and they are used everywhere; from schools to businesses, hospitals to entertainment. One of the most significant advantages of learning computer is that it opens up many job opportunities. These days, almost all jobs require computer skills, and having this knowledge can give one an edge in the job market. But that's not all. Knowing how to use a computer can also make one more productive and efficient, which is helpful in any work environment. It can also help with education, as computers are used for research, writing, and online learning. Having computer skills can make studying and learning much easier and efficient. Besides, computer skills can help one communicate with people from all around the world with the help of internet.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story below. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story. Give a suitable title to it.

Dilara is thirteen years old living in Swapnopur. Her poor parents have two other little children. It is hard for her illiterate parents to earn enough to run the family well. Dilara hopes to bring about a change to her family by receiving higher education. So she …………………..

sub_questions.explanation:
A Promise to Keep
Dilara is thirteen years old living in Swapnopur. Her poor parents have two other little children. It is hard for her illiterate parents to earn enough to run the family well. Dilara hopes to bring about a change to her family by receiving higher education. So she makes a promise to herself to study well from here on. One of her teachers once told her that there are schools in Swapnopur that offers scholarship to bright students. Getting a scholarship, would help her pursue the promise she made to herself. So, with strong determination and hard work, Dilara got good results in her final examinations. The school gifted her and other top students a bundle of books to applaud their effort. Dilara finished reading all of her book long before New Year. She was motivated by the idea that if she worked hard, a positive outcome would follow. However, the journey ahead proved to be a challenge. There is not always a positive outcome no matter how hard one works. But Dilara's old promise helped her stand firm on her ground. No matter how uncertain the future would be, she decided to never let uncertainty affect her present.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Arpita/Apon living in Chattogram. Your fricnd Nafis who lives in the USA is very much concemed about the frequent road accidents in Bangladesh. Now, iwrite an email to your friend describing the causes and effects of road accidents in Bangladesh.

sub_questions.explanation:
Subject: Causes and Effects of Road Accidents in Bangladesh
Dear Nafis,
I hope you're doing well and everything is great on your end! I received your message and your concern about the frequent road accidents in Bangladesh. It’s definitely an issue that’s causing a lot of distress here, and I appreciate that you care about it.
The main causes of road accidents in Bangladesh are numerous, and many of them stem from both human errors and infrastructure-related issues. One of the primary causes is reckless driving, which includes speeding, overtaking dangerously, and not following traffic rules. There’s also the issue of poor road conditions in many areas—potholes, lack of proper signage, and narrow lanes make driving hazardous. The absence of proper pedestrian crossings and traffic lights in certain areas also adds to the problem.
Another factor is the increasing number of vehicles on the roads, which has led to congestion and drivers sometimes feeling impatient. Many drivers don’t respect traffic signals or signs, and there is a lack of proper enforcement of laws, which makes things worse. Poor visibility at night due to a lack of streetlights and the use of mobile phones while driving are also significant contributors.
The effects of these accidents are devastating. Loss of life is the most tragic impact, with thousands of families affected each year. Those who survive often suffer from serious injuries, many of which require long-term treatment or result in permanent disabilities. Apart from the human cost, the economic impact is also severe. The government and families bear the medical and rehabilitation expenses, and accidents often cause traffic jams that affect daily life and productivity.
It’s clear that urgent action is needed, from improving road infrastructure to better enforcement of traffic laws and educating the public about road safety. There’s also a need for stricter penalties for those who break the law and more investment in public transportation to reduce the number of cars on the road.
I hope this gives you a clearer picture of the situation. Let’s hope that over time, things will improve as more attention is given to this issue.
Take care, and keep in touch!
Warm regards, Arpita Chattogram, Bangladesh

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Why can humans neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun?

b. Describe how human beings are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

c. What do you think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is?

d. Why enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year? Describe in brief.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun, because these things are beyond their control.

(b) Human beings do some unwise activities like burning too much fossil fuels, setting up more factories, cutting down trees indiscriminately, etc. that result in the increase of greenhouse gases. Thus, they are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

(c) I think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. With the increase of industrial activities, the combustion of coal has increased. Besides coal, mineral oil and natural gas are also burned for various purposes. Thus, every time a fossil raw material is burned, it releases carbon dioxide into the air.

(d) Enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture.
